unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace Across India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, 20/10/2024 - The nationwide smart meter deployment under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) is gaining momentum. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) and various state DISCOMs, including Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL), are actively installing these advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) devices.
normalised: New Delhi, twentieth October two thousand and twenty four - The nationwide smart meter deployment under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S) is gaining momentum. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (E E S L) and various state D I S C O M s, including Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (M S E D C L), are actively installing these advanced metering infrastructure (A M I) devices.

unnormalised: As of today, over 50 lakh smart meters have been installed across India, with plans to reach a target of 25 crore meters by 2025. These meters, offering real-time data and two-way communication, promise to reduce AT&C (Aggregate Technical and Commercial) losses, a significant challenge for Indian DISCOMs.
normalised: As of today, over fifty lakh smart meters have been installed across India, with plans to reach a target of twenty five crore meters by two thousand and twenty five. These meters, offering real-time data and two-way communication, promise to reduce A T and C (Aggregate Technical and Commercial) losses, a significant challenge for Indian D I S C O M s.

unnormalised: Speaking at a recent industry conference at IIT Bombay, Dr. Sharma highlighted the importance of data security and consumer awareness regarding smart meter benefits. Initial feedback from consumers in pilot project areas like Kanpur indicates a preference for the enhanced transparency in billing. Consumers can now monitor their consumption patterns via mobile apps at 17:00 hrs daily. Future phases will include features such as prepaid billing and integration with rooftop solar installations. The next progress review is scheduled for 14/11/2024. The initiative will help reduce power theft and improve the financial health of distribution companies. Rs. 30,000 crore has already been disbursed.
